main event: A civilian reported observing an unidentified aerial phenomenon in Dayton, Ohio on 15 September 23, 1955, for a duration of 4 seconds, and the conclusion was uncertain.
interesting points: The observer reported seeing one unidentified aerial object, which was observed for a very short duration of 4 seconds.

The questionnaire on the technical information sheet included detailed questions about the observation, including the position and movement of the object, the sighting conditions, and the observer's opinion on the nature of the object.
The report indicates that the observer saw the object while driving a car and provided details about the direction, speed, and position of the object.
The observer drew two sketches of the unidentified aerial objects, one showing a disc-shaped body with protrusions and the other showing an irregular, asymmetric shape.
The observer mentioned being an aero researcher for USARC and completed the questionnaire in 1953.
